title: The Potato Eaters
description: Depicts peasant hardship and early realism in Van Gogh's work. This somber painting shows five peasants gathered around a simple meal, representing Van Gogh's early focus on rural life and social realism.

title: The Starry Night
museum: Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), New York
description: Turbulent, emotional sky painted while Van Gogh was at Saint-Rémy asylum. This iconic work features swirling clouds, a bright crescent moon, and a cypress tree, representing Van Gogh's emotional state and artistic vision.

title: Sunflowers
description: Vivid still life symbolizing gratitude and friendship. Van Gogh painted multiple versions of sunflowers, using bold yellows to express joy and the beauty of nature.

title: The Bedroom
description: Personal depiction of his room in Arles. Van Gogh painted three versions of this intimate space, using simple furniture and bold colors to create a sense of rest and peace.

title: Portrait of Dr. Gachet
description: Psychological portrait of Dr. Gachet, Van Gogh's physician in Auvers. The painting shows the doctor with a melancholic expression, holding a foxglove plant used for heart conditions.

title: Wheatfield with Crows
description: One of Van Gogh's final paintings, often interpreted as expressing his emotional turmoil. The dramatic sky, crows, and winding paths create a sense of foreboding and finality.

title: Irises
museum: J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles
description: Painted during Van Gogh's stay at Saint-Rémy, this vibrant work shows purple irises against a background of orange marigolds, demonstrating his mastery of color contrast.

title: Self-Portrait with Bandaged Ear
description: Painted after Van Gogh's self-mutilation incident, this self-portrait shows him with a bandaged ear, pipe in mouth, and determined expression, reflecting his resilience.

title: The Yellow House
description: Depicts the house in Arles where Van Gogh lived and worked. He hoped to establish an artists' colony here, inviting Paul Gauguin to join him.

title: Café Terrace at Night
description: First painting where Van Gogh used starry backgrounds. The vibrant night scene shows a café in Arles with warm yellow light contrasting against the deep blue night sky.

title: Almond Blossom
description: Painted to celebrate the birth of his nephew, named Vincent. The delicate almond blossoms against a blue sky symbolize new life and hope.

title: The Church at Auvers
description: One of Van Gogh's final works, showing the church in Auvers-sur-Oise. The painting combines memories of Dutch churches with the French countryside.
